pages.text: If you go to try mine some ores, you'll see that even coal ore is not mineable. You can't even create stone tools to mitigate this. So what do you do? We'll get to that later (:/).

Before night approaches, you'll need to get yourself some charcoal to progress. This is very important as the mobs are much, much more powerful and common. So, staying out in the open will almost certainly lead to death. Consequently, burying yourself under the dirt is not necessarily ideal either as mobs can and will tunnel to you. But, if you go to deep into the darkness, the grue will eat you!

You'll need two things, a firestarter/firebow and some wood blocks (logs/wood/planks/stairs/slabs). You'll need to create a hole that can fit around 8 blocks. Keep one block exposed so that you can light it. To do this, sneak and use your fire starter of choice to light them, you'll know it's done right if smoke particles are present. Once ignited, patch it up so there are no holes.

It takes a couple minutes to make charcoal. So use this time to mine deep in a mountain in preparation for the night. Once your charcoal is done, use an axe to mine it, you'll get quite a bit and it should last you a while.
